intro: Wutongshania guangdongensis, commonly known as the Guangdong wutong, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lardizabalaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Guangdong province, and is characterized by its woody stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
